Leopard: yellow, tan, or white fur with black spots
accordion: a set of buttons on the other side
a set of reeds that produce sound when air is forced through them
anchor: a ring at the top for attaching a rope
a flat base for securing it to the ground
ant: black, brown, or red in color
two sets of wings (in some species)
three body parts (head, thorax, and abdomen)
barrel: a spigot or tap for draining liquid
a handle for carrying or moving the barrel
bonsai: wire or string to shape the branches
moss or rocks around the base
buddha: surrounded by a halo of light
butterfly: proboscis (long, thin tube for drinking nectar)
camera: input ports for connecting to other devices
ceiling fan: a central hub with blades attached
a light fixture or other decorative elements
a chain or pull cord for controlling the fan
a wall switch or remote control for turning the fan on and off
a mounting bracket for attaching the fan to the ceiling
cellphone: input ports for connecting to other devices
chair: a frame made of wood, metal, or plastic
chandelier: a chain or cord for hanging
a canopy or ceiling plate for mounting
cougar body: white fur on the chest and chin
cougar face: short fur with spots or stripes
crayfish: a tail with a fan-like shape
crocodile: yellow, green, or brown in color
crocodile head: two small eyes on the top of the head
a bony ridge along the back of the head
dollar bill: portrait of George Washington on the front
the words "One Dollar" printed on the front
the Great Seal of the United States on the back
the words "United States of America" printed on the back
a serial number printed on the front and back
a series year printed on the front and back
dolphin: blowhole on the top of the head
eyes located on the sides of the head
dragonfly: bright colors such as yellow, green, blue, or red
electric guitar: a body with a curved shape
euphonium: wide bell at the end of the tubing
ewer: a spout on the other side
ferry: multiple ramps for loading and unloading
flamingo head: black and white feathers on the head and neck
gerenuk: black stripes on the legs and face
grand piano: a lid that can be opened and closed
hawksbill: yellow or orange markings on the head and neck
headphone: two earpieces connected by a headband
helicopter: a main rotor and a tail rotor
inline skate: a boot-like shoe with a hard outer shell
four or five wheels arranged in a single line
a brake on the back wheel
a buckle or lacing system to secure the foot
a toe stop for stopping and turning
a frame connecting the wheels and the shoe
ketch: a main mast and a mizzen mast
a gaff-rigged mainsail and a mizzen sail
lamp: a switch or button to turn the light on and off
a reflector or diffuser to spread the light
laptop: input ports for connecting to other devices
a hinge to open and close the laptop
lotus: a seed pod at the center of the flower
a root system that anchors the plant in the mud
mayfly: two or three pairs of wings
often have a pale or light-colored body with dark markings
menorah: a candelabra with seven or nine branches
a base to support the branches
a tray or plate to hold the candles
a holder for the shamash (the candle used to light the other candles)
a decorative design or motif on the base or stem
metronome: a dial or knob to adjust the speed
a base or stand to support the device
a winding key to start the device
minaret: usually made of brick or stone
often has a balcony or platform at the top
may have a dome or spire at the top
may have a crescent moon or other Islamic symbols at the top
nautilus: a pair of retractable tentacles with suction cups
octopus: two eyes and four pairs of arms
two rows of suction cups on each arm
a mantle with an internal shell
a variety of colors and patterns
okapi: white stripes on the legs and hindquarters
pagoda: typically made of wood or stone
typically has a curved roof with multiple eaves
often has a spire or finial on the top
often has ornate carvings or decorations
often has a staircase leading up to the entrance
pizza: toppings such as pepperoni, mushrooms, olives, etc.
herbs such as oregano or basil
rooster: red or orange comb on top of head
wattles on the side of the head
spurs on the back of the legs
scissors: a pointed tip on one of the blades
a thumb and finger loop on the handles
a locking mechanism to keep the blades closed when not in use
scorpion: a segmented tail with a stinger
a pair of eyes on the head
a pair of antennae on the head
sea horse: bright colors such as yellow, orange, and red
soccer ball: black and white pentagonal and hexagonal pattern
made of leather or synthetic material
four or more layers of stitching
stapler: a release button for removing staples
starfish: central disc with a mouth at the center
stegosaurus: large, bony plates along its back
four spikes at the end of its tail
small head with a beak-like mouth
long hind legs and short forelegs
stop sign: the word "STOP" in large, white capital letters
a white border around the sign
a white arrow pointing in the direction of the stop
a reflective coating on the sign
tick: a pair of claws at the end of each leg
trilobite: a segmented body with three distinct lobes
a pair of legs per segment
umbrella: a closure mechanism such as a button or latch
watch: buttons or knobs for setting the time
a crown for winding the watch
a clasp or buckle for fastening the watch to the wrist
water lilly: a root system that anchors the plant to the bottom of the water
a thick, waxy coating on the leaves and flowers to protect them from the water
wheelchair: a frame made of metal or plastic
a joystick or other control device
windsor chair: a seat with a saddle-shaped curve
wrench: a ring or loop at the end of the handle
yin yang: two curved shapes, one black and one white, connected in the middle
a black dot in the white shape and a white dot in the black shape
a circle surrounding the two shapes
a line dividing the two shapes in the middle
